content:
Hey! A user I was chatting with suggested that it would be useful to pin PMs, and while we have an old issue for this (#10513), I think it would be worth discussing this a bit in the context of product changes/planned changes since then.

In particular, #10513 is currently tagged as a right sidebar issue (and was discussed this way in #backend > pinning users ), but at least some of the comments on the issue assume that it would be a left sidebar change.

Given that we now have PMs section you can pin open, the left sidebar approach makes more sense to me. I think our plans in Show stream members in right sidebar #21285 would also make a right sidebar change harder to manage.

What do folks think?
Yes, pinning conversations like streams would be nice... and topics inside Streams too :wink:
Pinned topics, pinned messages, and pinned PMs all sound useful :)
I think pinned PMs or pinned messages would be most useful to me.
These all sound great, though right now one doesn't visually get the status from users group PMs in the left panel, whereas a 'pinned users' (priority users?) would show that in the right column.
I added clarification that #10513 is a right sidebar issue, and filed Pinned PM conversations #24023, which should be actionable for a contributor who's excited to pick it up.
I have started the implementation discussion of this feature in Thread. It would be greatly appreciated if someone could help with the backend part.

Palash Baderia said:

I have started the implementation discussion of this feature in Thread. It would be greatly appreciated if someone could help with the backend part.

I would recommend asking a specific question (see https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/contributing/asking-great-questions.html) in #backend if you are feeling stuck.
